p: An antioxidant property is one of the most important biological properties exerted by the isoflavonoids. This effect has been suggested to facilitate prevention and slow progression against long-term diabetes complications including retinopathy, nephropathy, and neuropathy. It has been suggested that phytoestrogens that bear more than one hydroxyl group may be a more effective antioxidant against peroxyl radicals. It was also mentioned that antioxidant activity of genistein was due to conjugation of the C2â€“C3 double bond with 4-oxo atom in the A and C rings [ 109].
